kickstart.post:
import sys import os import rocks.sql
class App(rocks.sql.Application): def __init__(self, argv): rocks.sql.Application.__init__(self, argv)
def run(self): self.connect()
# Get the name of the PBS master. This should be the # name of the frontend machine.
try: master = "&Kickstart_PrivateHostname;" domainname = "&Kickstart_PrivateDNSDomain;" publicdomainname = "&Kickstart_PublicDNSDomain;" except: master = 'frontend-0' domainname = 'public' publicdomainname = 'public'
print "cat >", print "/var/spool/torque/mom_priv/config", print "<< 'EOF'" print '$pbsserver %s.%s' % (master, domainname)
self.execute("select nodes.name from" " nodes,memberships,appliances" " where nodes.membership = memberships.id and" " memberships.appliance = appliances.id and" " (appliances.name = 'frontend' or" " appliances.name = 'nas')")
for host, in self.fetchall(): print '$usecp %s.%s:/home /home' % (host, publicdomainname)
self.close() print 'EOF'
app = App(sys.argv) app.run()
SBIN_PATH=/opt/torque/sbin # NOTE: hostname flag must match what is listed in nodelist PBS_DAEMON="$SBIN_PATH/pbs_mom -A &hostname;" PBS_HOME=/var/spool/torque
# delay the addition of the service until we are absolutely sure we have a fully # configured system. If the service is activated in post itself it might be # started during the install phase before the system is ready. touch /opt/torque/firstboot
if [ -e /opt/torque/firstboot ]; then /sbin/chkconfig --add pbs_mom /sbin/chkconfig pbs_mom on /sbin/service pbs_mom start rm /opt/torque/firstboot fi
